Think about the goal youre trying to achieve. To make money day trading, you want to take advantage of the movement of a stock. The larger the movement, the more of a chance to make money. This is known as volatility. Stocks that have recently had good days are likely to have more if you catch it soon enough. These are top daily performers. Cheap volatile stocks that have performed well recently, will give you a chance to buy a large amount of shares, so if they go up a dollar or so you make at least 300. Some of the stocks that performed well the day before will continue for two more days. Some will spike in the morning and drop off immediately. Some may even drop as soon as the market opens. Selling during the morning spike ensures you get small profits, but try to give it a little bit of time if you can to see if it looks like the day will keep trending upward. If it starts sinking as soon as you buy, get out ASAP. Unless you see the price rising more than sinking. After watching the market from the start of the day to the end a few times, itll be pretty obvious if its going to go your way or not. Youll see stocks going up past the morning spike tend to keep going up. Stocks going down at the beginning of the day tend to keep going down. I think its a safer strategy to bet on obvious trending movements rather than trying to think youll predict a reversal. Thats some peoples entire strategy. Im a gamer, Im just trying to farm easy cash within the rules of the game. It doesnt have to be sophisticated or pretty. Experiment with the simplest strategy you can find. Itll be nerve racking at first but if you really pay attention and learn from your mistakes, and your wins, you can end up winning more than you lose. There will most likely never be a day in which all the top performing stocks one day, tank the next day. Some of them will, but I notice that if I pick a few from that list and the first one doesnt work, usually the next choices do. Dont look for a stock that has just spiked for a second during the day. Find one that has a strong consistent upward trend throughout the day. Your instincts will be that youre buying too high. Like Tom Hougaard says, the market isnt a grocery store, youre not trying to find a bargain. Just because its more expensive today than it was yesterday doesnt mean your chance to capitalize on its performance is over.

Depends on the brokerage. Yes Robinhood, no Fidelity. Fidelity Short selling, uncovered option writing, option spreads, and pattern daytrading strategies all require extension of credit under the terms of a margin account and such transactions are not permitted in a cash account. Robinhood Your account will be flagged for pattern day trading if you make 4 or more day trades within 5 trading days, and the number of day trades represents more than 6 of your total trades in that same 5 trading day period. This rule only applies to margin accounts and IRA limited margin accounts. Cash accounts arent subject to pattern day trading regulations. No trading with unsettled funds from stock and options sales. Stocks and options take 1 trading day to settle. So as long as you wait for the cash to settle youre good. Try to use only 12 your cash each trade if you want to trade every day. If you want to do two trades per day, use 14.

Dont do options. If you dont understand options you can lose a lot of money. If you do understand options you can lose an everloving shitton of money. If you watch this sub a week or two youll see guys posting 50k, 100k, 500k losses. Options were originally intended as a way to hedge your positions, and most hedge funds and serious investors still use them for that purpose. It works something like this Say i bought 10000 shares of nvda a couple years ago. Its gone up huge, lets say i paid 10 a share and theyre worth 100 a share now. I could buy long dated like years puts betting on it going to 50 or less. The puts would be very cheap for me to buy because thats very unlikely to happen but now in case something terrible does happen and nvda does crash my puts will pay off and i wont lose everything. Basically like insurance for stock positions, if that makes any sense.

Some people actually do research and make educated guesses but yea, people in this sub are mostly just gambling. Dont do options to gamble like this. This is not what they were originally intended for.

Take your pick. NTDOY or NTDOF. Im investing in the Super Nintendo Switch and trying to abuse latecycle investor distrust with Nintendos new console track record. The successor sounds like its just iterative, so it should be fine. Bear in mind that Nintendo historically has an early August Pokemon Presents, and the big game reveals tend to have large, often temporary, upswings. Faith in the imminent future propels the stock, and it has downswings whenever the current situation is forced to be highlighted. Im expecting a media blitz this month, and maybe even some first words on the Zelda movie, to draw eyes away from the NOW.
